attempts.raw_output: {"decision":"implement","reason":"Multiple users requested PowerShell/WSL/cmd/mintty and current guidance still relies on manual flags (for example `mintty -d`), so first-class integration is warranted.","priority":"P3-enhancement","estimated_files":["mRemoteNG/Connection/Protocol/IntegratedProgram.cs","mRemoteNG/Config/Settings/ExternalAppsLoader.cs","mRemoteNG/UI/Window/ExternalToolsWindow.cs","mRemoteNGTests/Connection/Protocol/IntegratedProgramTests.cs"],"approach":"Add explicit external-app presets and launch handlers for pwsh/cmd/mintty/WSL in IntegratedProgram, then add targeted regression tests for spawned-child process integration."}

result.reason: Native support for PowerShell, WSL, and cmd is a high-demand feature that simplifies configuration compared to current manual CLI flags.
result.approach: Implement presets and launch handlers for common shell tools (pwsh, cmd, WSL) within the protocol integration layer and add corresponding tests.
